status_notes: Program temporarily paused for upgrades as of research date. Contact 813-275-3050 for inquiries.

cyclic_incentive.notes: Rebate paid even if Tampa Electric does not assume control of equipment

continuous_incentive.notes: Rebate paid even if Tampa Electric does not assume control of equipment

continuous_eligible_rate_classes: Time of Day General Service, Non-demand (GSDT)
eligibility.telemetry_requirements: indicator lights (red: under control, amber: potential problem, green: normal)

baseline_methodology: Baseline determined by annual inspection date. Tampa Electric inspections performed at least once per year. Specific calculation methodology not publicly documented.

battery_suitability.rationale: Program is currently paused and designed for traditional controllable loads (AC, specialized equipment) rather than battery storage. No explicit mention of battery eligibility. However, TECO has separate utility-owned microgrid pilot with battery storage (37 homes in Hillsborough County) and partners with Enel for commercial DR programs that may include batteries.
battery_suitability.recommendations: Contact TECO at 813-275-3050 to inquire about battery eligibility once program resumes. Consider TECO/Enel commercial DR partnership for larger battery installations.

program_details.control_equipment: Tampa Electric installs control equipment at no cost to customer
program_details.monitoring_system: Equipment has indicator lights for status monitoring

microgrid_pilot.name: Block Energy System (BES) Microgrid Pilot
microgrid_pilot.description: Utility-owned microgrid with rooftop solar and battery storage for up to 37 homes in Medley at Southshore Bay development
microgrid_pilot.technology: Emera Technologies BlockEnergy system with battery storage

commercial_dr_partnership.description: Demand response program with incentive payments for load reduction during peak demand

market_context.notes: TECO operates in a vertically integrated utility model with no ISO/RTO wholesale market participation. DR programs are utility-managed for local reliability and peak reduction, not wholesale market arbitrage.

data_sources.source: Web search: Tampa Electric microgrid pilot program
data_sources.notes: Florida PSC approval documents and utility announcements

data_sources.source: Web search: TECO/Enel demand response partnership
data_sources.notes: Limited publicly available details on commercial DR program

research_notes: Florida operates under vertically integrated utility model with no ISO/RTO. TECO's Load Management Program is currently paused for upgrades. Program offers guaranteed monthly payments regardless of actual control events ($5-5.50/kW/month). No explicit battery storage language found, but TECO is actively investing in battery storage through utility-owned microgrid pilot and has commercial DR partnership with Enel. Traditional program appears designed for direct load control (AC, specialized equipment) rather than dispatchable storage assets. Baseline methodology not fully documented in public materials - requires direct contact with utility.
research_quality_notes: Good information on payment rates and program structure from primary utility source. Limited detail on baseline methodology, event parameters, and battery eligibility. Program currently paused which limits available documentation. Secondary sources provide context on TECO's broader battery storage initiatives.
